title: 2020 Renault Zoe review: the electric car becomes mainstream
text:
Has Renault’s all-electric supermini, the Zoe, really passed through three generations since its launch in 2013? That depends on who’s counting. In the subsequent six years, the likeable runaround has received a series of significant upgrades to batteries and motors, but only some have been deemed worthy of counting as a new generation. This minor-league facelift, with a more significant drivetrain and battery upgrade, is one of them.

There’s been a lot of water through the Straits of Dover since Renault first mooted its electric-car programme off the back of its Alliance partner, Nissan, and a lot of growing-up has been done in that time. Most telling of Renault’s realism in this business can...
description: Has Renault’s all-electric supermini, the Zoe, really passed through three generations since its launch in 2013?
